p: Municipal climate networks reinforce neoliberal logics in a similar way (Davidson & Gleeson, 2015). Entrepreneurial pursuits are also embedded in sustainability and climate discourse and climate agendas are employed by local authorities as formulas for city branding or new public management programs (Andersson & James, 2018; Béal & Pinson, 2015; Ng, 2019; Saldert, 2017) or continuation of resource appropriation on a global level (Schindler & Kanai, 2018). Scoppetta's (2016) account of post‐Katrina hurricane urban politics demonstrates how reconstruction efforts were connected with demolitions, displacement, and continued marginalization behind the politically neutral mask of resilience.
